description:
Fuyuki City - a city surrounded by the sea and mountains becomes the setting for an ancient ritual. Seven masters are given control of heroic spirits in order to realize the mythical Holy Grail, which is said to grant its owner any wish. These heroic spirits or servants represent legendary heroes of various classes: "Saber," "Lancer," "Archer," "Rider," "Caster," "Assassin," and "Berserker." Each master will enter into a contract with their chosen servant and battle the others to the death until only one pair remains... This is the "Holy Grail War."

The young and capable mage, Rin Tohsaka, prepares for her long-awaited Fifth Holy Grail War to begin... With her servant Archer, Rin enters the Holy Grail War as the sole heir to the prestigious Tohsaka family after her father's death. But when Shirou Emiya, a boy from Rin's school, unwittingly becomes a Master and is fatally wounded in battle, she has no choice but to save him. With Shirou and his servant Saber, Rin sets out to strike down the conspiracies surrounding the Holy Grail War. Will the Holy Grail bless Rin and Shirou's path toward victory or will they be cursed with defeat?

(Source: Aniplex of America)

Notes:
- Includes Prologue.
- The first, second and last episodes aired with a runtime of ~48 minutes as opposed to the standard 24 minute long episode.
synonyms: フェイト/ステイナイト Unlimited Blade Works

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

node.description: Originating from [Imagin](https://anilist.co/studio/75/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤友徳)

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Noted for his layouting skills.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/283471638)

Originating from [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/).

__[The BAMBOO BROOM (Blog)](http://www.remus.dti.ne.jp/~takeucto/)__

A Japanese author best known for writing the visual novels Tsukihime and Fate/stay night. Renowned for a unique style of storytelling and prose, Nasu is amongst the most prominent visual novelists in Japan. 

Together with high school classmate and friend, [Takeuchi Takashi](https://anilist.co/staff/99054/Takashi-Takeuchi), Nasu formed [TYPE-MOON](https://anilist.co/staff/97582) in 2000, originally as a doujin group to create the visual novel Tsukihime. It soon gained immense popularity, much of which is attributed to Nasu's unique style of storytelling. A sequel to Tsukihime, Kagetsu Tohya, was released on August 2001. 

54563 Kinokonasu is named after him

__[The BAMBOO BROOM (Blog)](http://www.remus.dti.ne.jp/~takeucto/)__

Takashi Takeuchi is a Japanese artist, noted as the co-founder of Japanese visual novel and anime development and production enterprise [TYPE-MOON](https://anilist.co/staff/97582), and for his illustrations on TYPE-MOON's visual novels, Tsukihime and Fate/stay night.

__Headquarters:__ Tokyo, Japan

__[Website](http://typemoon.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tmitterofficial)__

__Introduction:__
Type-Moon is a Japanese game company was founded by artist [Takashi Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/99054/Takashi-Takeuchi) and writer [Kinoko Nasu](https://anilist.co/staff/98250/Kinoko-Nasu), who were also schoolmates. The names "TYPE-MOON" and "Notes." come from one of their early works, Notes..

__History:__
Originally formed as a Doujin Soft in 2000 and created the popular visual novel Tsukihime, but turned into a Commercial Organization on January 30, 2004 and in the same year, they released their PC-based eroge visual novel game Fate/stay night, which is their most well known title.

[Website](https://hideyukifukasawa.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eicheph) | [Blog](https://eicheph.blogspot.com/)

Hideyuki Fukasawa is a Japanese composer. He has often worked with [Capcom](https://anilist.co/staff/109955/Capcom) but is also involved in his freelance composing work. He had a minor role in Onimusha 2 as an assistant sound engineer and programmer to [Taro Iwashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/100948/Tarou-Iwashiro), the acclaimed music composer of that particular game but it was his work on Chaos Legion, a Capcom Gothic action-adventure third-person fighting game in a similar fashion with the Devil May Cry series released in 2002, that gave him a cult-like status among video gaming fans. In 2008 he composed and arranged the music for Street Fighter IV, Marvel vs Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds, and the updated versions of both said games, with some tracks arranged from previous games.

He was the main composer for [TYPE-MOON's](https://anilist.co/staff/97582/TypeMoon) remake of the visual novel Tsukihime. 

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Chaos Legion (Video Game, 2003) (Composer)
- Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams (Video Game, 2006) (Composer)
- Street Fighter IV (Video Game, 2008) (Composer)
- Marvel vs. Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds (Video Game, 2011) (Composer)
- Street Fighter X Tekken (Video Game, 2012) (Composer)
- Witch on the Holy Night (Visual Novel, 2012) (Composer)
- Street Fighter V (Video Game, 2016) (Composer)
- TSUKIHIME -A piece of blue glass moon- (Visual Novel, 2021) (Composer) !~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/m_obunai) 

He is a graduate of Yoyogi Animation Gakuin. [Takuya Nonaka](https://anilist.co/staff/107164/Takuya-Nonaka), the current head of Ufotable Tokushima Studio, and animators [Yutaka Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101801/Yutaka-Nakamura) and [Junichi Fujisaku](https://anilist.co/staff/100423/Junichi-Fujisaku) were His classmates.

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).
Married to [Takayuki Hirao](https://anilist.co/staff/102247/).

[Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/101836362) | [Twitter](https://x.com/kojiroshishido)

[Kagami no Genon](https://anilist.co/anime/4091/sound--phantasma--mirror/) won the Excellence Prize in the 10th CG-ARTS Student CG Contest.
[Naked Youth](https://anilist.co/anime/5085/Naked-Youth/) won the best award in Tohoku University of Art & Design graduation exhibit.
Selection in 5th Norwich International Animation Festival.
Grand Prize in the 12th CG-ARTS Student CG Contest.
Recommended Work in 10th Japan Media Arts Festival.
Visual Prize in 19th DoGA CG Animation Contest. Screening at the 16th Tokyo International Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.  

And other works, music composed by animation Hikaru Yamakawa's "TOPE CON GIRO" and "OH HISSE". "OH HISSE" is screening at SIGGRAPH 2006 Animation Theater. 

Formerly affiliated with [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/ufotable).
Originating from [Imagin](https://anilist.co/studio/75/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/野中卓也)

Originating from Studio Wombat. He has been affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) since its establishment.

Born in Tokyo and raised in Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, he discovered his passion for anime during middle school, inspired by classics like [Galaxy Express 999](https://anilist.co/anime/1491/Galaxy-Express-999/) and [Lupin III: The Castle of Cagliostro](https://anilist.co/anime/1430/Lupin-The-3rd-The-Castle-of-Cagliostro/). It was in high school that he met a like-minded friend with a love for drawing, sparking his aspiration to become an animator. During those formative years, he actively participated in the art club, where he honed his skills and embarked on creating independent anime projects.

After graduating from the Yoyogi Animation Academy, he joined Studio Wombat as an in-between animator. During his time at the Yoyogi Animation Academy, he shared the same class with notable contemporaries such as [Mitsuru Obunai](https://anilist.co/staff/103077/Mitsuru-Obunai), [Yutaka Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101801/Yutaka-Nakamura), and [Junichi Fujisaku](https://anilist.co/staff/100423/Junichi-Fujisaku). His journey took a significant turn in 1999 when he played a pivotal role in the establishment of [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/ufotable). Gathering with visionaries like [Hikaru Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/103076/Hikaru-Kondou) in an old apartment in North Ikebukuro, Tokyo, they laid the foundation for what would become a renowned animation studio. In 2009, he made a significant move to the newly opened ufotable Tokushima Studio, where he assumed a leadership role, overseeing and nurturing a team primarily composed of young talents.

Originally harboring aspirations of becoming a director, he navigated a path from being an animator to realizing his dream. Armed with experiences in key animation and directing, he marked his directorial debut with "Hanaukyo Maid Team: La Verite." Following his move to ufotable Tokushima Studio, he assumed the position of chief of the directing department, leaving his mark on numerous episodes. In his directorial role, he approached each project with careful consideration, assigning cuts to the Tokushima Studio staff thoughtfully, illustrating his dedication and meticulous approach to his craft.
Originating from [Imagin](https://anilist.co/studio/75/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/野中卓也)

Originating from Studio Wombat. He has been affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) since its establishment.

His journey took a significant turn in 1999 when he played a pivotal role in the establishment of [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/ufotable). Gathering with visionaries like [Hikaru Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/103076/Hikaru-Kondou) in an old apartment in North Ikebukuro, Tokyo, they laid the foundation for what would become a renowned animation studio. In 2009, he made a significant move to the newly opened ufotable Tokushima Studio, where he assumed a leadership role, overseeing and nurturing a team primarily composed of young talents.

Originating from [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). Currently affiliated with [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

Originating from Studio Boomerang, currently affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). 

His role as a main animator on [Ikki Tousen: Dragon Destiny](https://anilist.co/anime/1956/) attracted a lot of attention. At ufotable he is one of the studio's key members among people like [Akira Matsushima](https://anilist.co/staff/119808/), [Masayuki Kunihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/146702/) and [Masaru Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/146698/).

Held in high regard by [Yasuomi Umetsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hikaruufo) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/近藤光)

Founder and representative director of [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Animation producer, sound director and music director for almost every ufotable production. He's also one of the scriptwriters in the studio.

__[Website](http://www.ayanomashiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ma_shi_ron) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ayanomashiro)__

Mashiro Ayano pre-debuted in volume 17 of LisAni! (May 2014 issue) as Mashiro in "Wingless Diver," as well as volume 18 (August 2014 issue) in "Setsuna Chronicle (刹那クロニクル)." She major-debuted in singing _Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works_ (TV) OP "ideal white" in October 2014.
Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).
Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

Rafael Antonio "Tony" Olivier is a Puerto Rican-born American voice actor best known for voicing Rick Hunter from Robotech, Lancer from Fate/stay night, and Arsène Lupin III from Lupin the Third. He helped produce the live action shows Mighty Morphin Power Rangers and VR Troopers.
